text:
1 word; punis.
That was the kinda off-beat chapter of TTYD. PM64 didn't have any off chapters. Every time I replay TTYD, chapter 2 kinda drags on for a while. Dont get me wrong, it was fun the first time, but afterwords it really loses its magic pretty fast, especially compared to chapter 3. PM64 keeps you page-turning cover to cover no matter how many times you play it.

author: VGSoundFX

text:
This was my favourite game to play on the Gamecube.
The story-line, the comedy, the awesome characters, and the amazing combat as well as the crowd and stage. 

Some people believe that the first Paper Mario was better. Don't get me wrong, the first Paper Mario was great and very fun; but, the way they made the story more intriguing by involving different parties such as Bowser, more involving dialogue from characters, and a lot more comedic skits, TTYD improved on many aspects of the original.

text:
@PaperMario15 The tons and tons of people around the internet who hate Halo and Call of Duty are no where near the tons and tons of people around the internet and the world who love Halo and Call of duty.

The Thousand-Year Door should be praised, talked about, and as popular as Mario 1, 3, 64, and Galaxy. I think even Sunshine gets more attention than Thousand-Year. Granted Sunshine is also a great game, but Thousand-Year is just one of the best games of all time. #10 in my top 10.

text:
I would have to say, that out of all the games I have played and beaten, this one takes the cake. It's my absolute favorite. The replayability is surprisingly high and I have never actually beaten the Pit of 100 Trials yet. I got close, then I ran out of star power, items, not dead partners, and just plain luck. One day though! One day I'll do it the hard way without go all BP and invisicloacks! I'll beat Bonetail with the sheer awesomness of skill and training!
Dear God I'm such a nerd.
author: DefendinMyBase

text:
@Fabrazz I loved the first two, and I loved Super Paper Mario just as much. Most of the reasons you have for disliking it are terrible. Paper Mario 64 is still the best in the series, but Super Paper Mario is pretty close.

Also, Galaxy 2 isn't even that great.

author: Alfonso ST

text: @HeyItsCheezy No. The 2D-Platformer Paper Mario Wii was terrible to anyone who liked the previous Paper Marios on GC and N64. First off, it obviously wasn't anywhere near to an rpg and had no combat system at all. Secondly, the world with "Pixls" or what-ever was strange and out of place. Let's hope the N3DS version will be indeed back to the roots, because TTYD here, was one of my best mario experiences thus far. Even exceeding Galaxy 2 just because I like RPGs more.

author: SomeCalcium

text:
Man..this game is so underrated, and it's one of THEE best games I have ever played, no doubt. It's seriously epic. Haha. But no, really. I mean, the good qualities of this game are countless. It's got surprisingly good humor that can actually make you laugh, a wonderful plot, cute characters, and it IS pretty difficult to beat if you don't have a walkthrough by your side at like all times.
So, props to you, Paper Mario: TTYD, props to you.
<3
